theorem putnam_1969_a4
: Tendsto (fun n => ∑ i ∈ Finset.Icc (1 : ℤ) n, (-1)^(i+1)*(i : ℝ)^(-i)) atTop (𝓝 (∫ x in Ioo (0 : ℝ) 1, x^x)) := by
  have h₁ : ∫ x in Ioo (0 : ℝ) 1, x^x = ∫ x in Ioo (0 : ℝ) 1, x^x := rfl
  rw [h₁]
  -- Use the fact that the integral of x^x from 0 to 1 is equal to the sum of the series (-1)^(n+1) * n^(-n) for n from 1 to infinity
  have h₂ : Tendsto (fun n => ∑ i ∈ Finset.Icc (1 : ℤ) n, (-1)^(i+1)*(i : ℝ)^(-i)) atTop (𝓝 (∫ x in Ioo (0 : ℝ) 1, x^x)) := by
    -- Use the fact that the series converges to the integral value
    have h₃ : ∀ n : ℕ, (fun n => ∑ i ∈ Finset.Icc (1 : ℤ) n, (-1)^(i+1)*(i : ℝ)^(-i)) n = ∑ i ∈ Finset.Icc (1 : ℤ) n, (-1)^(i+1)*(i : ℝ)^(-i) := by simp
    have h₄ : Tendsto (fun n => ∑ i ∈ Finset.Icc (1 : ℤ) n, (-1)^(i+1)*(i : ℝ)^(-i)) atTop (𝓝 (∫ x in Ioo (0 : ℝ) 1, x^x)) := by

        tendsto_integral_of_dominated_convergence (fun x => 1) (by
          -- Show that the function is dominated by 1

            <;> norm_num
            <;> linarith
          )
    exact h₄
  exact h₂
